verses.verse: Why<WH4100> dost Thou stand<WH5975> afar<WH7350> off, O Lord<WH3068>? Why dost Thou hide<WH5956> [Thyself] in times<WH6256> of trouble<WH6869>?
In pride<WH1346> the wicked<WH7563> hotly<WH1814> pursue<WH1814> the afflicted;<WH6041> Let them be caught<WH8610> in the plots<WH4209> which<WH2098> they have devised.<WH2803>
For the wicked<WH7563> boasts<WH1984> of his heart's desire,<WH8378> And the greedy<WH1214> man<WH1214> curses<WH1288> [and] spurns<WH5006> the Lord.<WH3068>
The wicked,<WH7563> in the haughtiness<WH1363> of his countenance,<WH639> does not seek<WH1875> [Him.] All<WH3605> his thoughts<WH4209> are, "There<WH369> is no<WH369> God.<WH430>"

His ways<WH1870> prosper<WH2342> at all<WH3605> times;<WH6256> Thy judgments<WH4941> are on high,<WH4791> out of his sight;<WH5048> As for all<WH3605> his adversaries,<WH6887> he snorts<WH6315> at them.
He says<WH559> to himself,<WH3820> "I shall not be moved;<WH4131> Throughout all<WH1755> generations<WH1755> I shall not be in adversity.<WH9563>"
His mouth<WH6310> is full<WH4390> of curses<WH423> and deceit<WH4820> and oppression;<WH8496> Under<WH8478> his tongue<WH3956> is mischief<WH5999> and wickedness.<WH205>

He sits<WH3427> in the lurking<WH3993> places<WH3993> of the villages;<WH9161> In the hiding<WH4565> places<WH4565> he kills<WH2026> the innocent;<WH9345> His eyes<WH5869> stealthily<WH6845> watch<WH6845> for the unfortunate.<WH2489>

He lurks<WH693> in a hiding<WH4565> place<WH4565> as a lion<WH9030> in his lair;<WH5520> He lurks<WH693> to catch<WH2414> the afflicted;<WH6041> He catches<WH2414> the afflicted<WH6041> when he draws<WH4900> him into his net.<WH7568>
He crouches,<WH1794> he bows<WH7817> down,<WH7817> And the unfortunate<WH2489> fall<WH5307> by his mighty<WH6099> ones.<WH6099>
He says<WH559> to himself,<WH3820> "God<WH410> has forgotten;<WH7911> He has hidden<WH5641> His face;<WH6440> He will never<WH1077> <WH5331> see<WH7200> it."
Arise,<WH6965> O Lord;<WH3068> O God,<WH410> lift<WH5375> up Thy hand.<WH3027> Do not forget<WH7911> the afflicted.<WH6035>
Why<WH5921> <WH4100> has the wicked<WH7563> spurned<WH5006> God<WH430>? He has said<WH559> to himself,<WH3820> "Thou wilt not require<WH1875> [it]."

Thou hast seen<WH7200> [it], for Thou hast beheld<WH5027> mischief<WH5999> and vexation<WH3708> to take<WH5414> it into Thy hand.<WH3027> The unfortunate<WH2489> commits<WH5800> [himself] to Thee; Thou hast been<WH1961> the helper<WH5826> of the orphan.<WH3490>
Break<WH7665> the arm<WH2220> of the wicked<WH7563> and the evildoer,<WH7451> Seek<WH1875> out his wickedness<WH7562> until Thou dost find<WH4672> none.<WH1077>
The Lord<WH3068> is King<WH4428> forever<WH5769> and ever;<WH5703> Nations<WH1471> have perished from His land.<WH6>
O Lord,<WH3068> Thou hast heard<WH8085> the desire<WH8378> of the humble;<WH6035> Thou wilt strengthen<WH3559> their heart,<WH3820> Thou wilt incline<WH7181> Thine ear<WH241>
To vindicate<WH8199> the orphan<WH3490> and the oppressed,<WH1790> That man<WH582> who is of the earth<WH776> may cause<WH6206> terror<WH6206> no<WH1077> more.<WH3254> <WH5750>
